summary: Feature request for official testing support in Node.js SDK, specifically for workflows and activities. Users need a TestWorkflowEnvironment similar to Java and Go SDKs, and better example projects with jest/eslint configuration.
userImpact: Without proper testing infrastructure, developers cannot easily test workflows in the Node.js SDK, limiting its adoption despite testing being a major selling point of Temporal.
rootCause: Core-based SDKs require a mocked server implementation for time-skipping support, which is a significant undertaking not yet completed for the Node.js SDK.
proposedFix: Implement TestWorkflowEnvironment for Node.js SDK with time-skipping support and mocked activity context; include basic jest configuration and project references in example projects.
workaround: Activities can be tested as async functions by mocking Context; workflows can be tested by running them with WorkflowClient, but this is not ideal.
resolutionDetails: Closed as part of issue cleanup; test framework implementation was planned and subsequently completed for Core-based SDKs.
keyQuote: Testability is a major selling point of Temporal but the Node SDK and its docs are currently lacking... There's no official support for testing Workflows and Activities.
